item.title: Numerous large pots holes, Road surface is also breaking up and subsiding into the drainage ditches. The whole lane requires resurfacing as it is subsiding in places and in a dreadful state of repair., 8th January
item.description:
What3words - remote.quail.movies for the worst potholes. Stoppage.printout.keeps for the entrance to the lane that requires resurfacing. It is a really busy No Through Road also used by heavy plant and lorries. The road surface is in such bad condition that there is a high risk of the road becoming impassable with no access to the properties along the lane.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashchurch Rural, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A deep pothole on the carriageway, 8th January
item.description:
The pothole is on Cleeve Road travelling towards Gotherington from Bishops Cleeve. It is a very deep pothole that has been there for nearly two months which is likely to cause significant damage to all types of road vehicles and their drivers, especially at night as there is no street lighting to help road users see it. I hit this pothole square on this afternoon and I've never experienced an impact like it. I will have to have my suspension and steering inspected to ensure they have not been damaged or misaligned. The co-ordinates for the pothole are - 51.961, -2.054. What three words - ///racks.birds.exhaling

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cleeve Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road markings obscured, 8th January
item.description:
The debris caused by recent flooding between Scraggs Folly and The Cottage in Cowley has become very solid completely obscures the road markings showing the direction of the thoroughfare through the village. Drivers are assuming that the road continues straight up the hill but the actual direction of the road bears left. Drivers intending to go up the hill are not stopping and indicating to turn right at the junction. Instead they are cutting across the path of oncoming traffic assuming that it is their right of way - which it is not. There have been several near misses in the last week alone. The road needs to be cleared so that the road markings are visible again - otherwise there is a risk of a serious collision.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cowley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: The drain is blocked problem, 8th January
item.description:
Customer reports a blocked drain at the location - they add that this has been an issue for at least the last 10 years since they moved there. In heavy rain the road is flooding and affecting 327 Prestbury Road and 1 and 2 Glebe Road. Mud has also been deposited across the carriageway in the recent rains; the customer has asked CBC to sweep this up. Please can Highways unblock this.
Report on FixMyStreet
